titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8328

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, 20 March 1862.

Hon:
Nat Gaither Jr
Sec: of State_

The following officers have been mustered out of service by the United States Military Board viz:
✓ John A. Brents 2d Major
✓ Wm A. Coffee 3d Major
✓ Geo. W. Drye Adjutant
✓ Geo. W. Sweeney Captain
✓ Wm Rains Captain
✓ Boston Dillian Captain } (Comms dated 28 Octo. 1861)
✓ Francis N. Alexander Captain (Com: dated 2 Decr 1861)
✓ R. M. Griffin 1 Lieut: (Com dated 2 Decr 1861) has resigned-

I send Eight Commissions for record viz:
(Over)
1861 Oct 9 Speed S. Fry Colo #1 ✓
" John T. Croxton Lt Colo #2 ✓
" P. Burgess Hunt Major #3 ✓
" Stephen L. Burdett Surgeon #4 ✓
" Mathew H. Young Asst Surg #5 ✓
1862 Feb 27 John W. Eades Chaplain #6 ✓
1861 Oct 9 Wm Goodloe Adjutant #7 ✓
" Michael Hope Qr Mas #8 ✓

Very Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
